rationale: A line chart is the most suitable for visualizing temporal data to show trends over time. This chart will clearly display the average processing time for Assembly Department B observations month by month throughout 2024, allowing for easy identification of trends and anomalies.
preprocessing_steps: Filter observations where the 'Observation' or 'Heading' text contains the phrase 'assembly department B' (case-insensitive, exact phrase)
Calculate the processing time in days as the difference between 'observation_processed_date' and 'observation_date'
Extract the month and year from 'observation_date' and label as 'observation_month' (formatted as 'YYYY-MM')
Calculate the average processing time for each month

suggestions.filtering: Filtered to 13 observations related to 'assembly department B' out of 40 total.

alternatives.rationale: An area chart is another good option for time-series data, providing a more visual representation of the magnitude of changes over time. This can be particularly useful if the user wants to see the cumulative effect of processing times.
A bar chart could also be used, especially if the user prefers discrete comparisons. However, it might not be as effective as a line or area chart for showing trends over time.
